usefulItems: 900 g loaf tin (2 lb), baking paper, aluminium foil, skewer, airtight container, oven
title: Sticky Jamaican Ginger Cake

ingredients.content: 40 g fresh root ginger, peeled, cut in round slices (2 mm)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C and line a large loaf tin (900 g/2 lb) with baking paper.
Place flour, bicarbonate of soda, cinnamon, mixed spice and ground ginger in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.
Add butter and chop <b>Turbo/2 sec/2 times<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place root ginger, crystalised ginger and sugar in mixing bowl then grind <b>4 sec/speed 10<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add evaporated milk, golden syrup and treacle then heat <b>2 min/50°C/speed 2<b>.
Add reserved spiced flour mixture and mix <b>10 sec/speed 3.5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and mix again <b>5 sec/speed 3.5<b>.

Add egg and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4.5<b>. Transfer to prepared tin. Bake for 35-45 minutes (180°C), covering with foil halfway through to avoid browning too much, until a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Leave to cool in tin before removing.
Wrap cooled loaf in foil and leave for at least 24 hours before serving.
Slice to serve or store in an airtight container until needed.

hintsAndTricks: The cake will get stickier and more moist the longer it is kept wrapped in foil.
